content:
This clash is written in a way that makes it seem extremely complicated and confusing when it's actually very simple.

Suggestions to make it a lot easier to understand:

"You must apply the same rearrangement algorithm to each section separately." =>
"You must order each section separately"

"[...] in ascending order with the fewest possible swaps." =>
"[...] in ascending order."
(the number of swaps is irrelevant, this is very misleading)

"For each section, the cars in ascending order based on the number of passengers after the necessary swaps, separated by a hyphen "-"." =>
"For each section, the cars in ascending order, separated by a hyphen "-"."

I just got this in a clash, and basically had to ignore the description and just assume the logic based on the first test case in order to solve it quickly. The only other human in my clash wasn't able to solve it, while one bot solution took over 6 minutes, and the other took 14m48s.

I think clearing up the description will make this much easier for people to understand and solve.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It would be fun to meet such puzzle in real-life CoC competition

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle.
This one is also quite good for the shortest mode.
This is also possible for reverse as test cases are nices and very well defined

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a simple and quick puzzle, however very interesting for one aiming to solve a puzzle in record time (probably under 30s).

Goal
* Please delete "ranging from 1 to T".

Input
* Please rewrite as:

<<Line 1>>: A line containing one or more train sections separated by a hyphen ({{-}}).

Each train section contains two or more space-separated positive integers representing the number of passengers in each car in that section.

Constraints
* Please delete the constraint. This section lets the players know what types of inputs/outputs they are expected to handle. Also, that "constraint" merely repeats what's been mentioned in Goal section, so it's not needed.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar. Hence:

(a) Please change Test 3 to contain 1 train section only.

(b) Please change Test 4 to contain 3 train sections.

Thanks.

Hello Contributor!
In Goal Section:
Rules:
"ranging from 1 to {{T}}" to ranging from {{1}} to {{T}}.

In Input:
"For each section" to <<For each section>>
why there are bracket after the passengers.
A hyphen "-" to A hyphen "{{-}}"

In Output:
separated by a hyphen {{"-"}} to separated by a hyphen "{{-}}"

Here some above mistakes so you can correct them.

How will you restrict players from breaking your one condition?
' but with one condition: you can only rearrange two adjacent cars at a time.'
I passed it without adhering to your condition.

My code in python:

ans=[]
for section in input().split(' - '):
    m,l=[],''
    for passenger in map(int,section.split()):
        m.append(passenger)
    for e in map(str,sorted(m)):
        l+=e+' '
    ans.append(l.rstrip())
print(*ans,sep=' - ')

Fixed. 
I deleted a constraint <<only rearrange two adjacent cars>> for this contribution. I will add some similar constraints in future contributions. Thank you for your remarks.

Hi, 
Fxed.
Thank you for your remarks

Review comments have been taken into account.

Thank you
Thank you for approving my contribution.

I've just made the simplification changes. Thanks again for these helpful comments.

I'll create a more dynamic and comprehensive version that takes into account traffic flow per car next time.

Thank you.

Goal
* Upon a further look, this whole sentence can be deleted because the unique number for each section is not used at all:

 Each section is identified by a unique number.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be *similar* but *not the same*. Please revise the cases.

Thanks.
